column2: MISSOURI DMV TEST
column4: Missouri
column6: MO

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: “Y” intersection ahead
column6: The road ends ahead
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 2. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Make eye contact.

column2: 3. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 4. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column4: turns sharply right, then left.
column6: curves right, then left.
column8: is a divided highway.

column2: 5. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 6. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: they must change lane immediately.

column2: 7. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.
column6: the road is narrower ahead.
column8: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 9. If you are ordered to install an ignition interlock on your vehicle, the cost of installation and monthly inspection must be paid by:
column4: the government.
column6: the judge.
column8: the court clerk.

column2: 10. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a low place in the road.

column2: 11. Which of the following statements regarding seat belts and child restraints in vehicles is true?
column4: Infants or small children should never be placed in the front seat of a vehicle with air bags.
column6: Drivers should always make sure all passengers are using a seat belt or child restraint.
column8: Air bags can be dangerous to infants even in low speed collisions.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road
column6: Right lane closed
column8: Winding Road Ahead

column2: 13. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: reduce the minimum following distance.
column6: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Pass with caution
column6: Yield the right-of-way
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 15. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: exclusively for stop signs.

column2: 16. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The driver on the left.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 17. If you have frames around your license plates, the frames:
column4: may cover the unessential part of the plate.
column6: must be approved by the MSHP.
column8: may cover the bottom third of the plate.
column10: must not cover any part of the plates.

column2: 18. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: switch to daytime lights.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 19. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: not turn right.
column10: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 20. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column6: delay near it.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.
column10: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 21. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: The road ends ahead
column6: One-way street
column8: No Passing Zone

column2: 23. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 24. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
column4: open your window.
column6: stop driving.
column8: get some coffee.

column2: 25. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
